com.whirvis.jraknet.protocol.message

Class EncapsulatedPacket

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.whirvis.jraknet.protocol.message.EncapsulatedPacket
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public final class EncapsulatedPacket
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    An encapsulated packet.

    These packets are sent within CUSTOM packets after initial connection has succeeded between the server and client.

    Since:
    JRakNet v1.0.0
    Author:
    Whirvis T. Wheatley

      • clone

        private EncapsulatedPacket clone

      • ackRecord

        public Record ackRecord
        The acknowledgement record. This is only used if the reliability is of the WITH_ACK_RECEIPT type.

        This is not used for packet encoding. Rather, when a sender gets an ACK packet, the event method onAcknowledge(RakNetClient, RakNetServerPeer, Record, EncapsulatedPacket) is called. Likewise, the same occurs when a NACK packet is received with the exception of onLoss(RakNetClient, RakNetServerPeer, Record, EncapsulatedPacket) being called instead.

      • reliability

        public Reliability reliability
        The packet reliability.

      • split

        public boolean split
        Whether or not the packet is part of a bigger split up packet.

      • messageIndex

        public int messageIndex
        The message index. This is only ever used if the reliability is of the RELIABLE type. This should always be one higher than the message index of the last reliable packet that was sent, as it is used to let the receiver know whether or not they have missed a reliable packet in transmission. This crucial in order for the RELIABLE_ORDERED reliability to function.

        It works like this:

        • 1. Sender sends reliable packet one to receiver.
        • 2. Receiver receives reliable packet one.
        • 3. Sender sends reliable packet two to receiver.
        • 4. Receiver does not receive reliable packet two as it is lost in transmission.
        • 5. Sender sends reliable packet three to receiver.
        • 6. Receiver receives reliable packet three, and realizes that it has lost reliable packet two, causing it to send a NACK packet.
        • 7. Sender sends reliable packet two again.
        • 8. Receiver receives reliable packet two and communication continues as normal.

        When a receiver receives a reliable packet, it is also always supposed to send an ACK packet back to the sender. This lets the sender know that the packet has been received so it can be removed from its cache. It is assumed that the receiver sent an ACK packet in each step describing the fact that it received a reliable packet.

      • orderIndex

        public int orderIndex
        The order index. This is only ever used if the reliability if of the ORDERED or SEQUENCED type.

        This is similar to the messageIndex, however this is used to determine when ordered packets are ordered and if a sequenced packet is the newest one or not. On the other hand, messageIndex is used to determine when reliable packets have been lost in transmission.

      • orderChannel

        public byte orderChannel
        The order index. This is only ever used if the reliability if of the ORDERED or SEQUENCED type.

        In total, there are a total of 32 channels that can be used to send ORDERED and SEQUENCED packets on. Both have their own set of these channels. It is good to make use of this if there are many different operations that must be ordered or sequenced happening at the same time, as it can help prevent clogging.

      • splitCount

        public int splitCount
        The amount of packets the original packet is split up into.

      • splitId

        public int splitId
        The ID the split packet.

      • splitIndex

        public int splitIndex
        The index of this split part of the packet in the overall packet. This is used to determine the order in which to put the split packet back together when each and every part has been received.

      • payload

        public Packet payload
        The payload.

      • size

        public static int size(Reliability reliability,
                       boolean split,
                       Packet payload)
        Calculates the size of an encapsulated packet if it had been encoded.
        Parameters:
        reliability - the reliability.
        split - true if the packet is split, false otherwise.
        payload - the payload, null if there is no payload.
        Returns:
        the size if it had been encoded.

        buf - the buffer to write to.

      • needsSplit

        public boolean needsSplit(RakNetPeer peer)
                   throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Returns whether or not the packet needs to be split.
        Parameters:
        peer - the peer the packet is being sent to.
        Returns:
        true if the packet needs to be split, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the peer is null.

      • split

        public EncapsulatedPacket[] split(RakNetPeer peer)
                           throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                                  java.lang.NullPointerException
        Splits the packet.
        Parameters:
        peer - the peer.
        Returns:
        the split up encapsulated packet.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the encapsulated is already split or if the packet is too small to be split according to needsSplit(RakNetPeer).
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the peer is null.

      • getClone

        public EncapsulatedPacket getClone()
                            throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Returns the cloned packet. If the packet has not yet been cloned, the clone() method will be called automatically. This method is recommended for use over the clone() method as it has checks put in place to prevent a CloneNotSupporteException from being thrown.
        Returns:
        the cloned packet, or the packet itself if it is the clone already.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if a CloneNotSupportedException is caught despite the safe checks put in place.
